newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SKK 790.3 mln Q1 pre-tax profit.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SKK 790.3 mln Q1 pre-tax profit.

text.p: Slovnaft a.s., Slovakia's sole crude oil refiner, said on Tuesday it posted a pre-tax profit of 790.3 million crowns for the first quarter of 1997, compared to a loss of 132.7 for the same period in 1996.
Slovnaft spokeman Lubomir Zitnan told Reuters that the firm's turnover for the first three months of the year was 12.6 billion crowns. Comparative turnover figures were not immediately available.

He said that the firm refined some 1.26 million tonnes of crude oil, up slightly from 1.19 million in the first quarter of 1996. First quarter sales totalled 9.6 billion crowns after 6.15 billion for the same period last year, he added.
Zitnan said first quarter exports were 3.44 billion crowns -- almost two-thirds of which went to the Czech Republic -- up from 3.0 billion in 1996.
Slovnaft controls around 80 percent of the domestic petrol station market.
Last year, Slovnaft exported about 50 percent of its production. Motor fuels account for about 63 percent of its overall refining capacity.
